page.title: 01Sellindge,the general area.
page.content: Our area is mostly countryside.It is in East Kent,between Folkestone and Ashford.There is a lot of farm land and two smallish villages called Brabourne Lees and Sellindge.Sellindge appeared in the first Domesday Book when it was known as"Sedlinges".There are many open fields in the area which are used for grazing or growing crops. The population is mainly old people, because they retire and come out of the big city.There are some woods and lots of brooks.The main attraction of the villages are the historical parts. The village of Sellindge has a railway line running through it but there is no station.The main road from Folkestone to London also goes through the village.There are lots of farms scattered around and there are lots of little lanes and fields with small streams running through them.
